title: The Concept of 'I' as the Divine Name

questions.question: What is the primary significance of 'I' as discussed in this module?
choices: A personal pronoun
A portal to infinite being
A grammatical construct
A symbol of ego
questions.answer: A portal to infinite being

questions.question: How does the concept of 'I' as a divine name differ from other divine names?
choices: It is specific to one religion
It is used only in formal rituals
It is universal and used by everyone
It requires special training to use
questions.answer: It is universal and used by everyone

questions.question: What is Maromak in Timorese spirituality?
choices: A sacred mountain
The supreme creator deity
A ritual object
A type of prayer
questions.answer: The supreme creator deity

questions.question: What does 'Rai Na'in' refer to in Timorese beliefs?
choices: Ancestral spirits
Catholic saints
Spirits of the land
Divine kings
questions.answer: Spirits of the land

questions.question: How is the concept of 'I' related to self-realization in spiritual traditions?
choices: It reinforces the ego
It is unrelated to self-realization
It is a tool for deep self-inquiry
It distracts from spiritual practice
questions.answer: It is a tool for deep self-inquiry

questions.question: What is the significance of the statement 'I am' in this context?
choices: A simple assertion of existence
An expression of the fundamental nature of reality
A grammatical construct
A way to introduce oneself
questions.answer: An expression of the fundamental nature of reality

questions.question: How does the concept of 'I' as a divine name relate to individual and universal being?
choices: It separates individual and universal being
It suggests individual 'I' is an expression of universal 'I'
It denies the existence of individual being
It promotes the supremacy of individual being
questions.answer: It suggests individual 'I' is an expression of universal 'I'

questions.question: What is Bei Ala in Timorese spirituality?
choices: A sacred text
A type of ritual
Ancestral spirits
A divine name for God
questions.answer: Ancestral spirits

questions.question: How is 'Ina Maria' used in Timorese Catholic practice?
choices: As a name for the supreme deity
As a reference to ancestral spirits
As an invocation for protection, especially by women
As a term for sacred land
questions.answer: As an invocation for protection, especially by women

questions.question: What ethical implication does the concept of 'I' as a divine name have?
choices: It promotes selfishness
It encourages disregard for others
It fosters respect and compassion for all beings
It has no ethical implications
questions.answer: It fosters respect and compassion for all beings

questions.question: What is the recommended approach to meditating on 'I' as a divine name?
choices: Focusing on personal achievements
Resting attention on the sense of 'I' without attachments
Repeating 'I' loudly and frequently
Visualizing oneself as a deity
questions.answer: Resting attention on the sense of 'I' without attachments

questions.question: How does the concept of 'I' as a divine name relate to the biblical passage 'I Am That I Am'?
choices: It contradicts the biblical passage
It suggests a direct link between our sense of 'I' and divine nature
It is unrelated to the biblical passage
It reinterprets the passage in a non-religious context
questions.answer: It suggests a direct link between our sense of 'I' and divine nature

questions.question: What is the primary goal of contemplating 'I' as a divine name?
choices: To inflate the ego
To achieve material success
To experience a shift in perspective towards unity
To develop psychic powers
questions.answer: To experience a shift in perspective towards unity

questions.question: How does the concept of 'I' as a divine name challenge conventional understanding?
choices: It reinforces traditional religious views
It questions the nature of individual identity and divinity
It promotes atheism
It emphasizes the separation between human and divine
questions.answer: It questions the nature of individual identity and divinity

questions.question: In Timorese Catholic practice, what does 'Nai Maromak' refer to?
choices: The Virgin Mary
Jesus Christ
Lord God
The Holy Spirit
questions.answer: Lord God

questions.question: What is the significance of divine names in Timorese spiritual traditions?
choices: They are used only for historical record-keeping
They are considered taboo and avoided
They are used in prayers, rituals, and for protection
They have no special significance
questions.answer: They are used in prayers, rituals, and for protection

questions.question: How does the concept of 'I' as a divine name relate to the idea of self-identity in Timorese culture?
choices: It contradicts Timorese concepts of self
It aligns with the connection between individual, family, and ancestral identity
It is completely foreign to Timorese culture
It only applies to Catholic Timorese
questions.answer: It aligns with the connection between individual, family, and ancestral identity

questions.question: What is the role of ancestors in Timorese spirituality?
choices: They are considered irrelevant
They are feared and avoided
They are honored and invoked for guidance and protection
They are only important in historical contexts
questions.answer: They are honored and invoked for guidance and protection

questions.question: How has Catholicism influenced Timorese concepts of self and divine identity?
choices: It has completely replaced traditional beliefs
It has had no impact on Timorese spirituality
It has introduced new concepts while blending with traditional beliefs
It is rejected by all Timorese people
questions.answer: It has introduced new concepts while blending with traditional beliefs

questions.question: What is the significance of naming ceremonies in Timorese culture?
choices: They are purely social events
They have no spiritual significance
They connect personal identity with spiritual and ancestral realms
They are only practiced by the elite
questions.answer: They connect personal identity with spiritual and ancestral realms

questions.question: How does the concept of 'I' as a divine name relate to Timorese animist beliefs?
choices: It contradicts animist beliefs entirely
It aligns with the idea of spirit presence in all things
It is unrelated to animist beliefs
It replaces animist beliefs with monotheism
questions.answer: It aligns with the idea of spirit presence in all things

questions.question: What is the purpose of offering betel nut to Rai Na'in in Timorese tradition?
choices: To harm the spirits
To ask permission before using the land
As a form of currency
To repel evil spirits
questions.answer: To ask permission before using the land

questions.question: How does the concept of 'I' as a divine name potentially impact one's sense of self-worth?
choices: It diminishes self-worth
It promotes arrogance
It fosters both humility and inherent worth
It has no impact on self-worth
questions.answer: It fosters both humility and inherent worth

questions.question: What is the relationship between individual 'I' and universal 'I' in this concept?
choices: They are completely separate
Individual 'I' is an illusion
Universal 'I' is an illusion
Individual 'I' is a unique expression of universal 'I'
questions.answer: Individual 'I' is a unique expression of universal 'I'

questions.question: How might the concept of 'I' as a divine name be applied to address contemporary issues in Timorese society?
choices: It is irrelevant to contemporary issues
By promoting individual supremacy
By fostering unity and mutual respect
By encouraging isolation from society
questions.answer: By fostering unity and mutual respect

questions.question: What is the significance of the universality of 'I' as a divine name?
choices: It suggests the divine is distant from human experience
It implies the divine is accessible only to certain cultures
It indicates the divine is intimately connected to all human experience
It means the concept is too vague to be meaningful
questions.answer: It indicates the divine is intimately connected to all human experience

questions.question: How does the concept of 'I' as a divine name relate to the practice of self-inquiry?
choices: It discourages self-inquiry
It is unrelated to self-inquiry
It serves as a focal point for deep self-inquiry
It replaces self-inquiry with external worship
questions.answer: It serves as a focal point for deep self-inquiry

questions.question: What potential challenge might arise when considering 'I' as a divine name in Timorese context?
choices: It may conflict with traditional polytheistic beliefs
It could be seen as too simplistic
It might be misinterpreted as ego inflation
All of the above
questions.answer: All of the above

questions.question: How does the concept of 'I' as a divine name potentially bridge traditional Timorese beliefs and Catholic teachings?
choices: It contradicts both belief systems
It emphasizes the divine nature within all beings, aligning with both traditions
It is only relevant to Catholic teachings
It only applies to traditional Timorese beliefs
questions.answer: It emphasizes the divine nature within all beings, aligning with both traditions
